page.title: 14LOCAL EVENTS
page.content: We have our Revel early in July every year to celebrate when Thomas Beeket was put into his great tomb in Canterbury Cathedral.He was murdered on Dec.27,but it was in early July some years later that he was put into the shrine.Our Revel has been held since 1190.First the RevelQueen walks up the Green between two lines of children, and she has six attendents behind her.She is crowned with flowers,then there is country dancing.After that we have sweet scrambling,lots of stalls,a band plays and there is Morris Dancing.On the next day there is usally an exibition of some sort,then on the Saturday afternoon there is a Cross Country race,football,Pet shows ,Fancy Dress and lots of stalls.On Sunday night,Songs of Praise in the church.
